title: אָשִׁיר בִּזְמִירִים | Ashir BiZmirim, a piyyuṭ before Qaddish (after Yishtabaḥ) on Shabbat Ḥanukkah by Yaaqov ibn Tsur
author: Isaac Gantwerk Mayer (transcription & naqdanut)

coauthors.name: Yaaqov ibn Tsur
coauthors.bio: Yaaqov ben Reuven ibn Tsur, or Jacob Abensur (1673–1753), born in Fez, Morocco, was a poet, scholar and leading Moroccan rabbi of the 18th century. He studied under the rabbis Vidal Serfaty and Menahem Serero. In 1693, he was appointed as registrar at the bet din (rabbinical court) of Fez, and then as a rabbi and head of the bet din in 1704, a post which he held for another thirty years. Thereafter, oppressive taxation induced him to move to Meknès, where he became a member of the bet din for eleven years, and after that he moved to Tétouan to serve in its bet din for another seven years. Ibn Tsur authored Mishpat u-Tsedeqah be-Ya’aqov, a published collection of some of his responsa, as well as Et le-khol Ḥefeẓ, a collection of piyyutim.

excerpt: Ashir BiZmirim — a piyyuṭ intended to be sung before Qaddish (after Yishtabaḥ) in the Shaḥarit of Shabbat Ḥanukkah — was written by the great Moroccan paytan Yaaqov ibn Tsur (1673–1753) of Fez. It was first put to print in the Sefer ‘Et l-Kol Ḥefetz, printed by ibn Tsur's descendants in 1893 in Alexandria. It may be sung to the melody of Yaḥid Arba, or the melody of Ya’atzor Me-’Ami.” . . .
content:
Ashir BiZmirim — a piyyuṭ intended to be sung before Qaddish (after Yishtabaḥ) in the Shaḥarit of Shabbat Ḥanukkah — was written by the great Moroccan paytan Yaaqov ibn Tsur (1673–1753) of Fez. It was first put to print in the Sefer ‘Et l-Kol Ḥefetz, printed by ibn Tsur’s descendants in 1893 in Alexandria. It may be sung to the melody of Yaḥid Arba, or the melody of Ya’atzor Me-’Ami.”
Source (Hebrew) Translation (English)
אָשִׁיר בִּזְמִירִים
לְיוֹצֵר הָרִים
מָסַר גְּבוּרִים
בְּיַד חַלָּשִׁים׃
I will sing in hymns
to the Maker of mountains,
who turned the mighty over
to the hand of the week.
נִלְכְּדוּ שׂוֹטְנַי
בְּיַד כֹּהֲנַי
בְּנֵי חַשְׁמוֹנַאי
גֶּֽזַע יְשִׁישִׁים׃
Adversaries mine were conquered
by the hand of my priests,
the Hasmoneans,
the elder race.
יֶשַׁע וּפֻרְקָן
לְעַמִּי נִתְקַן
כִּי לֹא נִתְרוֹקַן
פַּךְ הֶחָרָשִׁים׃
My people’s salvation
and rescue was fixed,
for the artisans’ vial
was not emptied.
יִסְּדוּ תּוֹרוֹת
חַכְמֵי הַדּוֹרוֹת
לְהַדְלִיק נֵרוֹת
שִׁשָּׁה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים׃
Judged the sages of the age
to establish teachings,
to light
thirty-six lamps.
עוֹמְדִים כְּסִדְרָם
בִּפְאֵר הֲדָרָם
אָכֵן לְאוֹרָם
אֵין מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁים׃
As they stand in their order,
in their glorious splendor,
indeed their light
is not to be used.
קוֹל שִׁיר בְּמִזְמוֹר
הַהַלֵּל נִגְמֹר
לְצוּר מִמַּכְמוֹר
הִתִּיר חֲבוּשִׁים׃
Choral song in hymn,
we will complete the hallel
to the Rock who freed
the wounded from the net.
בְּעֵת תְּפִלָּה
גַּם עֵת אֲכִילָה
נוֹדֶה בְּגִילָה
בְּטוּב רְחָשִׁים׃
On the hour of prayer,
by eating-time as well,
we will cheerfully thank
with quick speech of good.
אֵל נִסִּים עָשָׂה
לְעַם בּוֹ חָסָה
וְאוֹתָם פָּצָה
מִפַּח יוֹקְשִׁים׃
Signs the Deity did!
On the people They had mercy,
freeing them
from the fowler’s trap.
בְּעֻזְּךָ יוֹצְרִי
תָּאִיר עוֹד אוֹרִי
וְתָהֵל נֵרִי
כְּעֵין תַּרְשִׁישִׁים׃
Now, my Maker, on Your strength,
make my light yet glow,
so my lamp may shine
like beryls.
נוֹצֵר חֲסָדִים
שׁוּר רֵעִים דּוֹדִים
בָּם זֵדִים רוֹדִים
אֲדוֹנִים קָשִׁים׃
Favors You keep;
behold the beloved friends;
whom arrogant,
cruel masters tyrranize!
צוּר יֶֽשַׁע צַוֵּה
וְטוּבְךָ רַוֵּה
לְעַם בְּקַצְוֵי
אֶרֶץ נְטוּשִׁים׃
Zenith, command salvation,
and make Your goodness plentiful
for the people left
to the earth’s ends!
וּלְדַל נֶאֱלָח
פְּדוּתְךָ תִּשְׁלַח
וְחִישׁ תְּשַׁלַּח
רְצוּצִים חׇפְשִׁים׃
Unto the poor despised ones,
send Your redemption,
and hurry,
let the oppressed go free!
רוֹמֵם עַם הוּדַשׁ
וּבְנֵה בֵּית מִקְדָּשׁ
תִּגְדַּל תִּתְקַדַּשׁ
בְּסוֹד קְדוֹשִׁים׃
Raise the trampled people,
and build the Temple;
be great, be sanctified
in the holy assembly!

Source(s)

Sefer Et l-Kol Ḥefets (Yaaqov ibn Tsur) page 33b
